src.ges.geo_utils.adjust_point_projection(points_3d, z)[source]

Find if the point 3d are in front of the camera (z distance), in case of any of the points are outside of the field of view, an equivalent point shall be found. :param points_3d: :param z: positive value corresponding to plane in front of the camera. :return:

src.ges.ges_dataset module

class src.ges.ges_dataset.GESDataset(loc_path: Optional[Union[str, Path]] = None, name: Optional[str] = None)[source]

Bases: object

create_scenario(flight_data, fov_vertical=30, fov_horizontal=30, width=3840, height=2160, nb_frames=100, fps=25, times=None, export_metadata=False)[source]

Take the flight_plan generated by generate_landing_poses() to convert it into a esp format file

static generate_landing_poses(runaway_db, airport: str, runway: str, trajectory: DefaultTrajectory)[source]

distribution: str = ‘exp’, distrib_param: float = math.sqrt(2), alpha_v_deg: float = -3, std_alpha_v_deg: float = 0.2, alpha_h_deg: float = 0., std_alpha_h_deg: float = 2., min_distance_m: float = 150., max_distance_m: float = 10000., roll_deg: float = 0., std_roll_deg: float = 5., pitch_deg: float = -4., std_pitch_deg: float = 2., std_yaw_deg: float = 5., sample_number: int = 1000, dist_ap_m: float = 300.):

Take a trajectory config and return a flight plan (ie. all the camera positions and rotations according to the config file)

Parameters:

  • airport (str) – code of the airport

  • runway (str) – code of the runway

  • alpha_v_deg (float, optional) – vertical angle. Defaults to -3.

  • std_alpha_v_deg (float, optional) – standard deviation of alpha_v. Defaults to 0.2.

  • alpha_h_deg (float, optional) – horizontal angle. Defaults to 0..

  • std_alpha_h_deg (float, optional) – standard deviation of alpha_h. Defaults to 2..

  • min_distance_m (float, optional) – minimal distance from the runway in meters. Defaults to 150..

  • max_distance_m (float, optional) – maximal distance from the runway in meters. Defaults to 10000..

  • roll_deg (float, optional) – roll angle. Defaults to 0..

  • std_roll_deg (float, optional) – standard deviation of roll angle. Defaults to 5..

  • pitch_deg (float, optional) – pitch angle. Defaults to -4..

  • std_pitch_deg (float, optional) – standard deviation of the pitch angle. Defaults to 2.

  • std_yaw_deg (float, optional) – standard deviation of the yaw angle. Defaults to 5.

  • sample_number (int, optional) – number of footages. Defaults to 1000.

  • plot_scatter (bool, optional) – Defaults to True.

Returns:

The flight plan(ie positions and camera angles)

load_data()[source]

Extract the frame parameters which are in a json file generated by GoogleEarth Studio.

Frame information:
“cameraFrames”:[
{ “position”: {“x”: … , “y”: … , “z”: …}

“rotation”: {“x”: … , “y”: … , “z”: …} “coordinate”: {“latitude”: … , “longitude”: … , “altitude”: … } “fovVertical”:

}, { “position”: …. }, …

]

Returns:

None

src.ges.ges_dataset.add_or_update_runways(database_file: str, airport_ocai: str, runways: str, coordinates)[source]

Update the database with new runways or update the coordinates of existing ones.

Parameters:

  • database_file (str) – file containing coordinates of the runways

  • airport_ocai (str) – code of the airport

  • runways (array of str, max length of 2) – Runway code and optionally the id of the opposite runway

  • coordinates (numpy array of floats, with shape (4, 3)) – table of 4 points, each defined by latitude, longitude and altitude

src.ges.ges_dataset.compute_aiming_point(database_file: str, airport_ocai: str, runway_id: str, dist_m: float)[source]

get the aiming point on the runway at a distance ‘dist’ from the LTP

Parameters:

  • database_file (str) – file containing coordinates of the runways

  • airport_ocai (str) – code of the airport

  • runway_id (str) – code of the runway

  • dist_m (float) – distance of the aiming point from the LTP

src.ges.ges_dataset.define_offset(aiming_point, rwy_psi, ltp, fpap, traj)[source]

distribution,

alpha_v_deg: float = -3, std_alpha_v_deg: float = 0.2, alpha_h_deg: float = 0., std_alpha_h_deg: float = 2., min_distance_m: float = 150., max_distance_m: float = 10000., roll_deg: float = 0., std_roll_deg: float = 5., pitch_deg: float = -4., std_pitch_deg: float = 2., std_yaw_deg: float = 5., sample_number: int = 1000, par_distrib1=0, return all the camera positions and angle with the deviations we get more footage when close to the aiming point with the exp(sqrt(2))

src.ges.ges_dataset.generate_dist(min, max, sample_number, distribution: str, par_distrib1=0)[source]

generate the distances from the runway

uniform: uniform between min and max distances exp: uniform(0,1)**par_distrib1 then reshape to [min, max] par_distrib <1 -> more images far from the runway

par_distrib >1 -> more images near the runway

normal: normal distribution troncated to have the maximum of the distribution at 1

src.ges.ges_dataset.get_runway_points(database_file: str, airport_oaci: str, runway_id: str)[source]

Return the points around the runway (4 corners, ltp and fpap)

Parameters:

  • database_file (str) – file containing coordinates of the runways

  • airport_oaci (str) – code of the airport

  • runway_id – code of the runway
